itemDescription: first female professor of politics on the island of Ireland (1947-2018)

wikipedia_page.main: Elizabeth Marian Meehan (23 March 1947 - 6 January 2018) was a distinguished academic and the first female professor of politics on the island of Ireland.

response: Elizabeth Meehan (22 August 1894 – 24 April 1967), also billed as Betty Meehan, was a British screenwriter who worked in both Britain and Hollywood.

Meehan had a daughter, Frances Meehan Williams (1930-2006), who became an actress and later a psychotherapist. Elizabeth Meehan died in 1967, in New York, aged 72 years. Her daughter donated some of her original scripts and screenplays to the Special Collections library at UCLA.
*Elizabeth Meehan, 70, Scottish political scientist.Distinguished academic who became first female professor of politics
